content.title: Exercise Ball Hip Flexor Stretch Instructions

items: Start by sitting on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground.
Slowly walk your feet forward until your lower back is resting on the ball.
Place your hands on your hips and slowly lift one foot off the ground, bringing your knee towards your chest.
Hold this position for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your hip flexor.
Slowly lower your foot back to the ground and repeat on the other side.
Repeat this stretch 2-3 times on each side.

Exercise Ball Hip Flexor Stretch Benefits

items: Improves flexibility and range of motion in the hip flexors
Reduces tightness and discomfort in the hip flexors
Helps alleviate lower back pain by releasing tension in the hip flexors
Improves posture and balance by strengthening the core muscles
Can be modified for different levels of flexibility and mobility
Requires minimal equipment and can be done at home or in the gym
